Jacob Kroeze

Web development, design, responsible Data use, and the philosophy of it all

About Jacob Kroeze

I'm ready for the next thing -- making clever projects for the internet, writing concise how-to-do-it blog posts and articles, and reading anything esoteric. A fan of Ruby, I use vim, git, et. al. on ubuntu or W|nd*ws powershell with msys-git while at work. Jekyll, Sinatra, and Ruby on Rails have been my good friends for the past year. I'm in the market to do market research to fulfill my love for learning about people and how we all work together. I also am available for small web development projects and total office reorganization.

Menubook — Concept of a menubook to store workplace lunch menus and place orders.
One Page Nav Buttons — Navigation Buttons for page scrolling.
